description.narrative: For GGF funds will be used to bring together women farmers, agricultural workers, indigenous women, and environmental advocates through a 6 day Rural Women's Leadership Training. The training will cover issues on biodiversity, food, agriculture and gender issues, and will offer skills building on leadership, media campaign and policy advocacy. The group hopes that the convening will (1) ensure that women have increased awareness and understanding of issues related to gender and agriculture, food security, biodiversity and human rights; (2) enhance the capacities in advocacy and lobbying work of rural women's organizations and leaders in national, regional and global policy processes; (3) assist participants in enhancing self confidence and awareness of their rights; and (4) ensure that participants become capable trainers in their communities and organizations
